p: According to the localization, ARTIs are divided into 2 categories: lower respiratory tract infections (LRTIs) and upper respiratory tract infections (URTIs). URTIs refer to pathogenic manifestations of rhinosinusitis, tonsillitis, pharyngitis, laryngitis/laryngotracheitis and otitis, while LRTIs include tracheitis, bronchitis, bronchiolitis, and bronchopneumonia [ 5]. LRTIs are more harmful than URTIs and thus account for most of the serious disease burden. They are the major cause of hospital admissions in young children in the developed world [ 6].
